segment.source: These articles provide example code for common Universal Windows Platform (UWP) cryptography tasks, such as creating random numbers, comparing buffers, converting between strings and binary data, copying to and from byte arrays, and encoding and decoding data.
segment.target: These articles provide example code for common Universal Windows Platform (UWP) cryptography tasks, such as creating random numbers, comparing buffers, converting between strings and binary data, copying to and from byte arrays, and encoding and decoding data.

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: These articles provide example code for common Universal Windows Platform (UWP) cryptography tasks, such as creating random numbers, comparing buffers, converting between strings and binary data, copying to and from byte arrays, and encoding and decoding data.
segment.target: These articles provide example code for common Universal Windows Platform (UWP) cryptography tasks, such as creating random numbers, comparing buffers, converting between strings and binary data, copying to and from byte arrays, and encoding and decoding data.

segment.source: This example code shows how to create a random number or buffer for use in cryptography in an UWP app.
segment.target: This example code shows how to create a random number or buffer for use in cryptography in an UWP app.

segment.source: This example code shows how to compare buffers in an UWP app.
segment.target: This example code shows how to compare buffers in an UWP app.

segment.target: Convert between strings and binary data

segment.target: Copy to and from byte arrays

segment.source: This example code shows how to encode and decode base64 and hexadecimal data in an UWP app.
segment.target: This example code shows how to encode and decode base64 and hexadecimal data in an UWP app.
